column4: double check that both Master and PCM are not muted, and are not at zero
where is the master? I can see PCM under 'Volume Control'
maybe check that you're controlling the alsa driver (one never knows)
can you run "alsamixer" in aterminal ?
I'm too noob to know what that means sorry - I have 1 hour experience with Linux
yes
ok, what are you using? ubuntu with gnome? kubuntu ?
alsamixer is ok ?
ubuntu with gnome - a simple install off the CD ISO
if alsamixer works, you can see the master column, and the pcm column right?
ok it's just a different alsa driver I guess
well just check all columns related to output are not at zero, and that you don't  have 'MM' at the bottom (but 'OO' instead)
type 'm' :)
what was the column which prevented output?
and can you change device from the file menu?
just wondering why you couldn't change it in the graphical interface... you opened the sound control from the panel on top of the screen right?
yes I did, but it had slightly different options
can you check if you can change the device in the File menu of this sound control dialog?
yes, if you can choose between OSS and alsa you should choose alsa
there seems to be more options in alsamixer than 'Volume Control'
in the volume control you can choose what to display in Edit -> Preferences
so you still don't have a control for Front ?
yes I do now thanks
ok :)
